  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: EAST ALTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP BY DRIVER (PLASTIC JUG IN A CARDBOARD OVERPACK). AS UNLOADER WAS PREPARING TO UNLOAD THEY NOTICED STRONG SMELL AND SAW BOX LEAKING. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND PROCESSED ALL REMAINING PRODUCT THROUGH DMP. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED LID ON THE PLASTIC JUG WAS LOOSE.

item.title: Report E-2024020148
item.description:
Report E-2024020148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 2, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was removed from the area and absorbent material was used for clean up.

DescribePack: liquid had begun slipping through the lid that was to loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: it was put in a leaker tote and taken to QA for us to handle

item.title: Report X-2024020317
item.description:
Report X-2024020317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-14
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed flammable liquid package was discovered wet. Further inspection of the package confirmed that the 1 liter glass bottle inside was shattered during transit DescribePack: Glass bottle packaged inside a plastic bag and absorbent pads wrapped around it, but the glass bottle shattered and caused internal release of the isopropanol product inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Evaporated/ Contained inside plastic bag

item.title: Report X-2024020223
item.description:
Report X-2024020223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: MARION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer 811023 from NTSO-633 arrived and was opened, before the trailer was completely open it was apparent there had been a major spill, when the trailer as completely opened the culprit of the leak fell onto the station floor. The trailer had a total of 4 corrosive HAZMATSs loaded on it, none of them were braced and there was no load net on the trailer. DescribePack: The point of failure was the cap, contents seeped through due to improper bracing leading to the package falling over DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was no longer releasing contents when the trailer was opened, the 13 other packages affected be the release absorbed the spill.

item.title: Report I-2024020015
item.description:
Report I-2024020015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: Posen
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While at truckstop, a leak was detected coming from trailer. Posen Fire Department was dispatched to assess. Area was isolated and Hazchem Environmental Corp was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Hazchem applied absorbent material to the affected asphalt and inpsected the trailer. One 55-gallon drum was discovered at nose of trailer, which had been punctured by a sharp object in transit. Hazchem proceeded to offload the trailer, overpacked the damaged drum, and cleaned the trailer floor. All spent absorbents were recovered from trailer floor and affected asphalt, which were placed into two 55-gallon drums. Product was contained to an impervious surface and did not threaten to impact surface soils or state waters. Two 55-gallon drums of spent absorbents and cleanup debris, and one overpack drum, were generated during cleanup, which were transported off site pending disposal. There were no injuries or exposures reported. ,
